head.supplied: Bonang ¶ 6/5/89. ¶ ¶ […] and there seems to exist evidence already that the "Blue Gum" of the Colombo and Bega district is very irregular in its flowering time, and has according to my friend Allan h...

div.p: MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, 89/176, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

[…] and there seems to exist evidence already that the "Blue Gum" of the Colombo and Bega district is very irregular in its flowering time, and has according to my friend Allan hardly flowered since I forwarded log, bark etc. to you two years ago. You will remember that Baron von Muller then considered the species as either quite new or a Hybrid. On my way through Colombo last January, I recieved
sic.
from my friend Allan a complete set of specimens of it, which I forwarded to Baron von Muller at once, but have not heard about it since. The flowers were however very scanty. While I think of it I may also state that since I last wrote
89/152, 14/4/89.
I have independent evidence that the specimens of the Eucalypt from Tingiringi Mountain could not have been labelled by me two years ago as E. Gunnii, and must have been mixed up by Mr. Home In one of my late letters to Baron von Muller I mentioned quite casually that two authorities in Sydney are inclined to consider the species new, in reply to which he says that he could not understand that anyone could do so by the material so far sent by me; that he could not decide until he had more fully developed flowers, and that two years ago he considered it to be E. stricta var. Luehmanniana . I know as a positive fact that then he did not give me the name of the variety, but I am quite sure that it was E. stricta , and if you have it at all, as such I labelled it. […]
Not relevant.
